title: Setting up your support email in Gmail - video guide
description:
Don’t let emails slip through the cracks! With Freshdesk, you can track issues, prioritize them and work with your team to resolve them faster.
Learn how to forward and convert your emails to tickets using Freshdesk here.
desc_un_html: Don’t let emails slip through the cracks! With Freshdesk, you can track issues, prioritize them and work with your team to resolve them faster. Learn how to forward and convert your emails to tickets using Freshdesk here.

title: Navigation and Dashboard
description: Navigate faster between the various sections in your helpdesk with the icon-based navigation panel and stay on top of helpdesk metrics that matter the most to you. Read more about team dashboards here.
desc_un_html: Navigate faster between the various sections in your helpdesk with the icon-based navigation panel and stay on top of helpdesk metrics that matter the most to you. Read more about team dashboards here.

title: Setting up the Feedback Widget
description: Freshdesk lets you collect feedback and support requests directly from your website, portal or any third party web page. This lets your customers submit a ticket to your helpdesk without having to look around for your self-service portal or remember your support email. Read more here.
desc_un_html: Freshdesk lets you collect feedback and support requests directly from your website, portal or any third party web page. This lets your customers submit a ticket to your helpdesk without having to look around for your self-service portal or remember your support email. Read more here.

title: Setting up the help widget
description:
With the help widget, you can embed solution articles and/or a contact form within your website or product. When your customers need help, they can open the widget to search through solution articles or to submit a ticket. 


To learn more about the help widget, you can

  • read our solution articles that will help you set up solution articles and a contact form in the help widget, embed it on your website, and configure advanced functionalities using the widget's APIs
  • watch a webinar which walks you through the basics of the widget
  • refer to our API documentation to make use of the advanced functionalities of the widget


Please note: Attachments don't work in Widget and Conversation Inbox.
desc_un_html: With the help widget, you can embed solution articles and/or a contact form within your website or product. When your customers need help, they can open the widget to search through solution articles or to submit a ticket.      To learn more about the help widget, you can   read our solution articles that will help you set up solution articles and a contact form in the help widget, embed it on your website, and configure advanced functionalities using the widget's APIs  watch a webinar which walks you through the basics of the widget  refer to our API documentation to make use of the advanced functionalities of the widget      Please note: Attachments don't work in Widget and Conversation Inbox.

title: Setting up an Email Outreach (Proactive Support)
description: With Proactive Outreach in Freshdesk, your support teams can identify, understand, and reach out proactively to customers the moment they run into trouble, in turn creating a memorable brand experience for them. Read more here.
desc_un_html: With Proactive Outreach in Freshdesk, your support teams can identify, understand, and reach out proactively to customers the moment they run into trouble, in turn creating a memorable brand experience for them. Read more here.

title: Customising Ticket Forms
description: Customize the ticket form to include different fields specific to the type of your business or your support process using Freshdesk. You can collect customer information that is unique to your business by creating custom fields for these details. Read more here!
desc_un_html: Customize the ticket form to include different fields specific to the type of your business or your support process using Freshdesk. You can collect customer information that is unique to your business by creating custom fields for these details. Read more here!

title: Reordering Automation Rules
Setting up Scenarios
description: Agents often need to perform a series of actions or tasks before they can push a ticket to the next level - tasks that are not unique to that ticket. For example, with tickets concerning refunds, you'd have to tag the ticket as Refund, assign the ticket to the Refunds group, and set the status of the ticket to Processing Refund. Scenarios in Freshdesk lets you perform a number of tasks with a single click, right from within a ticket. So every time there's a ticket about a refund, all you have to do is execute that scenario and the ticket is tagged, assigned and has its status changed without you lifting a finger. Read more here.
desc_un_html: Agents often need to perform a series of actions or tasks before they can push a ticket to the next level - tasks that are not unique to that ticket. For example, with tickets concerning refunds, you'd have to tag the ticket as Refund, assign the ticket to the Refunds group, and set the status of the ticket to Processing Refund. Scenarios in Freshdesk lets you perform a number of tasks with a single click, right from within a ticket. So every time there's a ticket about a refund, all you have to do is execute that scenario and the ticket is tagged, assigned and has its status changed without you lifting a finger. Read more here.

title: Setting up your Sandbox
description:
As a helpdesk administrator, you would want to test out a configuration or feature before enabling it on your Freshdesk account. For example, when you add a new workflow, you need to make sure it doesn't affect your customers or agents before you’ve had a chance to test and fine-tune it completely.


With the Sandbox feature, you can avoid making irreversible changes. The sandbox is a replica of your Freshdesk account. Read more here.
desc_un_html: As a helpdesk administrator, you would want to test out a configuration or feature before enabling it on your Freshdesk account. For example, when you add a new workflow, you need to make sure it doesn't affect your customers or agents before you’ve had a chance to test and fine-tune it completely.     With the Sandbox feature, you can avoid making irreversible changes. The sandbox is a replica of your Freshdesk account. Read more here.

title: Working with the Ticket List page
description: The Tickets tab lets you filter out and view a list of tickets that you want to get working on. You can filter out tickets by source, type, status, agents assigned to, tags, products, and even the custom fields that you have created. Read more here.
desc_un_html: The Tickets tab lets you filter out and view a list of tickets that you want to get working on. You can filter out tickets by source, type, status, agents assigned to, tags, products, and even the custom fields that you have created. Read more here.

title: Working with the Ticket Details page
description: Increase your agents' productivity by making use of all the features Freshdesk has to offer for your helpdesk workflow. Access customer data right within that customer's ticket, reply, notify, share solution articles, and collaborate with external stakeholders right from the ticket details page in Freshdesk. Read more here.
desc_un_html: Increase your agents' productivity by making use of all the features Freshdesk has to offer for your helpdesk workflow. Access customer data right within that customer's ticket, reply, notify, share solution articles, and collaborate with external stakeholders right from the ticket details page in Freshdesk. Read more here.

title: Working with Contacts & Companies
description:
Freshdesk helps you keep track of all the customers reaching out to your helpdesk, letting you create and save them as contacts under the Customers tab. You would also be able to group specific contacts and map them to a company.


When a ticket is created by a new requester, a contact is automatically created in your helpdesk. These contacts can be seen in the Contacts tab.Read more here.
desc_un_html: Freshdesk helps you keep track of all the customers reaching out to your helpdesk, letting you create and save them as contacts under the Customers tab. You would also be able to group specific contacts and map them to a company.     When a ticket is created by a new requester, a contact is automatically created in your helpdesk. These contacts can be seen in the Contacts tab.Read more here.

title: Using Canned Forms
description: Requests often come in with limited information and you might end up asking a set of repetitive questions to your customers. While replying, the customer would have to copy and paste the set of questions before they begin to answer them. Using Canned forms, you can now process these requests efficiently and with ease. These readily accessible form templates are customizable and help in resolving major service requests faster. Read more here.
desc_un_html: Requests often come in with limited information and you might end up asking a set of repetitive questions to your customers. While replying, the customer would have to copy and paste the set of questions before they begin to answer them. Using Canned forms, you can now process these requests efficiently and with ease. These readily accessible form templates are customizable and help in resolving major service requests faster. Read more here.

title: Sorting Ticket Conversations
description: The order in which they see conversations within the ticket details page, be it chronological or reverse chronological, should be a choice that they make. Admins can enable their agents to view the newest conversations on top with a single click, so they don’t have to scroll down every time to find the latest updates on a ticket. Read more here.
desc_un_html: The order in which they see conversations within the ticket details page, be it chronological or reverse chronological, should be a choice that they make. Admins can enable their agents to view the newest conversations on top with a single click, so they don’t have to scroll down every time to find the latest updates on a ticket. Read more here.

title: Automation - Rules that run on ticket creation
description:
These rules allow you to setup your support workflows by performing a predefined set of actions on newly created tickets. These rules let you automate actions such as:

  • Assigning tickets to the right groups and/or agents

  • Setting ticket properties like status, priority, and type

  • Triggering email notifications to agents and requesters

  • Deleting tickets or marking them as spam
desc_un_html: These rules allow you to setup your support workflows by performing a predefined set of actions on newly created tickets. These rules let you automate actions such as:    Assigning tickets to the right groups and/or agents    Setting ticket properties like status, priority, and type    Triggering email notifications to agents and requesters    Deleting tickets or marking them as spam

title: Automation - Rules that run on hourly triggers
description: Automation rules that run on hourly triggers (FKA time triggers) in Freshdesk allow you to bring your workflows into your helpdesk and define specific actions based on time and event-based triggers. With these automation rules, you can set up a simple rule to send out reminder emails automatically, if the customer hasn't gotten back with the information in, say, 48 hours.
desc_un_html: Automation rules that run on hourly triggers (FKA time triggers) in Freshdesk allow you to bring your workflows into your helpdesk and define specific actions based on time and event-based triggers. With these automation rules, you can set up a simple rule to send out reminder emails automatically, if the customer hasn't gotten back with the information in, say, 48 hours.

title: Automation - Rules that run on ticket updates
description: Automation rules that run on time triggers in Freshdesk allow you to bring your workflows into your helpdesk and define specific actions based on time and event-based triggers.
desc_un_html: Automation rules that run on time triggers in Freshdesk allow you to bring your workflows into your helpdesk and define specific actions based on time and event-based triggers.

title: What has changed in Freshdesk Automations
description: We've given the automations module a neat upgrade! Admins can now set up Dispatch'r, Supervisor, and Observer rules under one single module. Read more here.
desc_un_html: We've given the automations module a neat upgrade! Admins can now set up Dispatch'r, Supervisor, and Observer rules under one single module. Read more here.

title: Thank you detector (powered by Freddy)
description:
The Thank You Detector, powered by Freddy, can understand the intent of customer responses to 'resolved' or 'closed' tickets to decide if it should be reopened or not. Read more here.


This feature is now available as the Freddy Insights addon.
desc_un_html: The Thank You Detector, powered by Freddy, can understand the intent of customer responses to 'resolved' or 'closed' tickets to decide if it should be reopened or not. Read more here.     This feature is now available as the Freddy Insights addon.

title: Approval workflow in the Freshdesk knowledge base

title: Understanding Email Notifications
description:
You can find Email notifications in the Workflows section on your admin page. They are helpful for generic scenarios like sending a notification when a new ticket is created or when a ticket is closed. 

For configuring customized email notifications based on ticket attributes, such as ticket type, group, source, requester name, and more, use the Automations feature. This is especially useful to route tickets to the right agent or group if your organization is spread across timezones, skills, and languages.


Watch this video to learn how to set email notifications up based on your organization or team's needs.
desc_un_html: You can find Email notifications in the Workflows section on your admin page. They are helpful for generic scenarios like sending a notification when a new ticket is created or when a ticket is closed.   For configuring customized email notifications based on ticket attributes, such as ticket type, group, source, requester name, and more, use the Automations feature. This is especially useful to route tickets to the right agent or group if your organization is spread across timezones, skills, and languages.     Watch this video to learn how to set email notifications up based on your organization or team's needs.
seo_data-meta_title: email notifications in Freshdesk
seo-data-meta_description: Email notifications and automations for agents in Freshdesk based on ticket attributes

title: What to Do if None of Your Emails are Getting Converted into Tickets
description:
If none of your emails are getting converted to tickets, we've put together a few ways to go about fixing it yourself. First, you need to check if you're using a default email server and check if forwarding is set up for your mailbox. Then, ensure that your support email address and the Freshdesk forwarding email address are not the same.  

Watch this video to know how you can fix these issues.
desc_un_html: If none of your emails are getting converted to tickets, we've put together a few ways to go about fixing it yourself. First, you need to check if you're using a default email server and check if forwarding is set up for your mailbox. Then, ensure that your support email address and the Freshdesk forwarding email address are not the same.    Watch this video to know how you can fix these issues.
seo_data-meta_title: emails not getting converted into tickets
seo-data-meta_description: why no emails are getting converted into tickets in Freshdesk

title: What to Do if Specific Emails are Not Getting Converted into Tickets
description:
If specific emails are not getting converted into tickets, there could be a few issues behind the scenes. Two possible reasons are that the contact that sent the email could be deleted from Freshdesk or an automation rule is marking tickets as spam. 


Watch this video to know how you can fix these issues.
desc_un_html: If specific emails are not getting converted into tickets, there could be a few issues behind the scenes. Two possible reasons are that the contact that sent the email could be deleted from Freshdesk or an automation rule is marking tickets as spam.      Watch this video to know how you can fix these issues.
seo_data-meta_title: specific emails not getting converted into tickets
seo-data-meta_description: why specific emails are not getting converted into tickets in Freshdesk
